New Records: Quinton de Kock scored a record 174 runs, his third century in five innings, and surpassed Virat Kohli and David Warner for the most runs in the World Cup.
Heinrich Klaasen contributed with a quick 90 off 49 balls in his 150th ODI, showcasing his explosive batting.
South Africa achieved their third 350-plus total in the World Cup, jumping to second place in the points table.
Key Match Events: South Africa's bowlers dismissed key Bangladeshi players like Shakib Al Hasan and Litton Das, crucial wickets in the match.
De Kock and Klaasen formed a massive 142-run partnership in just 87 balls, a pivotal moment in the match.
The match saw Bangladesh's Mahmudullah scoring 111, reducing the defeat margin, despite the team's batting struggles.
Post-Match Reflections: The win was a morale booster for South Africa ahead of the World Cup, with the team moving to second place in the points table.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was high-scoring, with South Africa reaching a 350-plus total for the third time in the World Cup.
Bangladesh's batting resilience, led by Mahmudullah, kept the game prolonged despite the heavy defeat.
